intro: Inula repanda, commonly known as the smooth inula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by a series of bracts that give it a distinctive appearance. Inula repanda is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
